ProcessState class

The process state class describes the last known state of the build process. On each motion event it evaluates the input and modify its instance variables accordingly. (See evaluate_assembly() for assembly events and pick_part() for pick events.

class process_state.ProcessState(solution)

Bases: object

Data class that contains information about a process state.

Parameters

solution¶ (Solution) – Solution to the path problem that is the basis for the assembly process.

Variables

  • state_grid – StateGrid that shows where obstacles and completed layouts occupy nodes

  • aimed_solution – Solution that contains information of the desired construction. Is recalculated after a detour event.

  • last_event_trail – Trail at which the last non deviated event occurred.

  • part_stock – See PartStock

  • picked_parts – list [int] containing part IDs picked from stock. Parts will be removed upon assembly.

  • building_instructions – (See BuildingInstructions) Dictionary containing information about the required assembly and IDs of parts to complete the construction process. Is recalculated after a detour event.

  • motion_dict – Dictionary (See MotionDict) containing all registered motion events that are valid (non-error) that point to a ConstructionState. The keys for pipe events are of the type Trail, while other events are of the type Pos.

  • last_event_info – Dictionary (See BuildingInstructions) containing information of the last event that occurred.

get_construction_state(find_me, event_codes)

returns construction state and pos/trail if pos and event_code specified are in motion_dict.

Args: find_me (Union [Pos, Trail]): Position or trail to find in motion_dict. event_codes (list [int]): List containing event codes valid for search.

Returns

If nothing was found, returns a tuple containing None, otherwise returns a tuple containing a Pos or Trail and its ConstructionState

pick_part(event_code, part_id, ignore_empty_stock)

Evaluates the pick event in the context of the current process state and registers changes to the PartStock and other class instance variables if the action was valid.

Parameters

  • event_code¶ (int) – See event_code

  • part_id¶ (int) – Part ID that was picked.

  • ignore_empty_stock¶ (bool) – See ignore_empty_stock

Returns

PickEventResult

evaluate_assembly(event_pos, event_code, ignore_part_check=False, ignore_obstructions=False, assume_pipe_id_from_solution=False)

Evaluates the assembly event in the context of the current process state and registers changes to the MotionDict if the action was valid. Also registers if a building_instruction.BuildingInstruction has been fulfilled.

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ (pos) – pos where motion event occurred.

  • event_code¶ (int) – Event code of motion event (See Encoding Information)

  • ignore_part_check¶ (bool) – Option for ignoring part restrictions. See ignore_part_check

  • ignore_obstructions¶ (bool) – Option for ignoring obstructions. See ignore_obstructions

  • assume_pipe_id_from_solution¶ (bool) – Option for assuming a certain pipe ID has been placed, if motion event occured on solution and pipe ID is among the parts that have been picked.

Returns

AssemblyEventResult

get_current_layout_and_building_instruction(event_code, event_pos)

Returns the current layout and BuildingInstruction if event occurred inside solution.

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ (Pos) – See event_pos

  • event_code¶ (int) – See event_code

Returns

tuple [BuildingInstruction, Trail, bool] containing the current layout (Trail), BuildingInstruction and a value that signifies if the layout has changed from the previous one.

register_assembly(building_instruction, construction_state, event_code, event_pos)

Registers assembly event to motion_dict.

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ (Pos) – See event_pos

  • event_code¶ (int) – See event_code

  • building_instruction¶ (BuildingInstruction) – The current building instruction.

  • construction_state¶ (ConstructionState) – Construction state of the current motion event.

part_removed(event_pos, event_code, event_result)

Removes event_pos from the motion dict, if already in motion dict.

Parameters

  • event_result¶ (assembly_event_result.AssemblyEventResult) – Event result being modified.

  • event_pos¶ (Pos) – See event_pos

  • event_code¶ (int) – See event_code

Returns

tuple [Pos, ConstructionState] containing the Pos and ConstructionState of the motion event of the part that was removed, else None.

attachment_placed(event_pos, event_code, building_instruction, event_result)

Evaluates the assembly of an attachment. Notes findings to event_info.

Parameters

  • event_result¶ (AssemblyEventResult) – Event info being modified.

  • building_instruction¶ (BuildingInstruction) – Building instruction of the current layout.

  • event_pos¶ (Pos) – See event_pos

  • event_code¶ (int) – See event_code

pipe_placed(event_pos, building_instruction, event_result, ignore_part_check, assume_pipe_id_from_solution)

Evaluates the assembly of a pipe. Notes findings in event_info.

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ (Pos) – See parameter event_pos

  • event_result¶ (AssemblyEventResult) – Event result being modified

  • building_instruction¶ (BuildingInstruction) – Building instruction of the current layout.

  • ignore_part_check¶ (bool) – Option for ignoring part restrictions. See ignore_part_check

  • assume_pipe_id_from_solution¶ (bool) – See assume_pipe_id_from_solution

pipe_placed_deviated_route(event_result, ignore_part_check)

Pipe assembly evaluation if either motion event occurred outside solution or if assume_pipe_id_from_solution has been set to True in evaluate_assembly().

Parameters

  • event_result¶ (AssemblyEventResult) – Event info being modified.

  • ignore_part_check¶ (bool) – Option for ignoring part restrictions. See ignore_part_check

Returns

Event part ID (int)

  • event_result¶ (AssemblyEventResult) – Event info being modified

  • building_instruction¶ (BuildingInstruction) – Building instruction of the current layout.

check_assignment_pipe_id(current_layout)

Identifies and assigns IDs to motion events with unidentified pipe IDs based on placed fittings.

Parameters

current_layout¶ (Trail) – The current layout.

assign_pipe_id(pipe_state, pipe_id)
get_detour_event(event_pos, event_code)

Checks if conditions for a detour event are met. Detour event occurs if:

  1. 2 fittings in proximity (connectable by available parts)

  2. 1 attachment in between those 2 fittings

  3. 1 pipe (with correct or open id) in between those fittings

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ (Pos) – See event_pos

  • event_code¶ (int) – See event_code

Return: BuildingInstructions containing the detour event.

reevaluate_motion_dict_from_solution(solution, detour_event=None)

Reevaluates all entries in the motion dict according to the given solution.

Parameters

  • solution¶ (Solution) – New solution.

  • detour_event¶ (BuildingInstructions) – Cause of the detour event.

Returns

Trail with type_aliases_pos in the order according to the solution.

obstructed_part(event_pos, event_code)

Checks if motion event obstructed an already placed part.

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ (Pos) – See parameter event_pos

  • event_code¶ (int) – See parameter event_code

Returns

Event code (int) of part that was obstructed or None if no part was obstructed.

obstructed_obstacle(event_pos)

Checks state grid if motion event obstructed obstacle.

Parameters

event_pos¶ (Pos) – See parameter event_pos

Returns

bool if motion event obstructed obstacle.

set_completion_state(current_layout, event_result)

Sets completion state of current layout and neighboring layouts. Updates state grid on completed layouts.

Parameters

  • event_result¶ (assembly_event_result.AssemblyEventResult) –

  • current_layout¶ (Trail) –

completed_instruction(building_instruction)

Checks if the building instruction was completed. Additionally, returns the next event code needed to advance the completion of this instruction.

Parameters

building_instruction¶ (BuildingInstruction) – Building instruction of the current layout.

Returns: tuple containing if building instruction was completed (bool) and event code (int) corresponding to the next event code needed to advance the completion of this instruction.

get_positions_from_motion_dict(event_code)
Returns

set containing all positions for given event_code in the motion dictionary.

pipe_placed_detour_event(event_pos, event_result, building_instruction, pipe_id)

Pipe assembly reevaluation for detour events. Similar to pipe_placed().

Parameters

  • event_pos¶ (Pos) – See parameter event_pos

  • event_result¶ (AssemblyEventResult) – Event info being modified

  • building_instruction¶ (BuildingInstruction) – Building instruction of the current layout.

  • pipe_id¶ (int) – Pipe ID of the construction state being reevaluated.

Return:

get_num_open_pipes()
Returns

Amount of pipes (int) with open ID in motion dictionary.
